author: wsjcom
title: Gold Down Slightly as Dollar Rebounds
text:
Gold prices inched lower Friday with the dollar climbing.
Front-month gold for February delivery declined 0.2% to $1,328.20 a troy ounce on the Comex division of the New York Mercantile Exchange to cap off its worst week since early December. Prices have fallen 2.5% off their highest level since August 2016 recently with the dollar rebounding from multiyear lows, as a stronger U.S. currency makes gold and other dollar-denominated commodities more expensive for overseas buyers.
